item.description:
Pacific Northwest National Labs' expert cybersecurity system, ALOHA, can recreate attacks and test them against organizations' infrastructure to bolster defense.

item.title: Lawmakers move to extend two cyber programs (again) in funding proposal
item.description:

ğŸ“° Source: The Record | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Dismantling Defenses: Trump 2.0 Cyber Year in Review
item.description:
The Trump administration has pursued a staggering range of policy pivots this past year that threaten to weaken the nationâ€™s ability and willingness to address a broad spectrum of technology challenges, from cybersecurity and privacy to countering disinformation, fraud and corruption. These shifts, along with the presidentâ€™s efforts to restrict free speech and freedom of the press, have come at such a rapid clip that many readers probably arenâ€™t even aware of them all.
ğŸ“° Source: Krebs on Security | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Happy 16th Birthday, KrebsOnSecurity.com!
item.description:
KrebsOnSecurity.com celebrates its 16th anniversary today! A huge "thank you" to all of our readers -- newcomers, long-timers and drive-by critics alike. Your engagement this past year here has been tremendous and truly a salve on a handful of dark days. Happily, comeuppance was a strong theme running through our coverage in 2025, with a primary focus on entities that enabled complex and globally-dispersed cybercrime services.
ğŸ“° Source: Krebs on Security | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: News

item.title: Tesla hacked, 37 zero-days demoed at Pwn2Own Automotive 2026
item.description:
Security researchers have hacked the Tesla Infotainment System and earned $516,500 after exploitingÂ 37 zero-days on the first day of the Pwn2Own Automotive 2026 competition. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: Hackers exploit security testing apps to breach Fortune 500 firms
item.description:
Threat actors are exploiting misconfiguredÂ web applications used for security training and internal penetration testing, such as DVWA, OWASP Juice Shop, Hackazon, and bWAPP, to gainÂ access to cloud environments of Fortune 500 companies and security vendors. [...]
ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: Fortinet admins report patched FortiGate firewalls getting hacked

ğŸ“° Source: BleepingComputer | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Security News

item.title: Online retailer PcComponentes says data breach claims are fake

item.title: Chainlit AI framework bugs let hackers breach cloud environments

item.title: UK: North West Ambulance Serviceâ€™s increased breach reports may reflect better reporting
item.description:
Warrington Worldwide reports: Newly released figures from Data Breach Claims UK have highlighted growing concerns about data security in ambulance services, as emergency responders are increasingly exposed to cyber risks and information-handling failures. Data obtained by the company shows that North West Ambulance Service NHS Trust has recorded almost 400 data breach incidents over the... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: 2025: Double the breaches, but less patient data compromised
item.description:
Jill Hughes reports: In 2025,Â the frequency of healthcare data breachesÂ moreÂ than doubled. However, the number of patient recordsÂ exposedÂ has significantly decreased,Â indicatingÂ a shift in the data breach landscape, according to a newÂ report from Fortified Health Security. â€œThe healthcare sector is experiencing more frequent cyber events with smaller data footprints, driven largely by ransomware, identity compromise, and third-party weakness,â€... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: UK: Secret gagging order should not have been used to cover up Afghan data breach, Sir Ben Wallace says
item.description:
Holly Bancroft reports: SirÂ Ben WallaceÂ has said he would not have backed the use of a secret gagging order to cover-up the catastrophicÂ Afghan data breachÂ that potentially put thousands of Afghans who helped UK forces at risk from the Taliban. The former defence secretary told MPs on Tuesday that he had directed that a time-limitedÂ injunctionÂ be used toÂ protect... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: How crypto criminals stole $700 million from people â€“ often using age-old tricks
item.description:
Joe Tidy reports on the explosion of cryptocurrency thefts and scams over the past few years. Thereâ€™s a lot of materialÂ in the post, but of particular interest to DataBreaches was this part of his report: â€œData is a common problem as Bitcoin millionaires are becoming so frequent, and there are stolen databases that are... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: SK Telecom files lawsuit to revoke record 135 bln-won fine over data breach
item.description:
Lee Minji reports: SK Telecom Co., South Koreaâ€™s largest mobile carrier, has filed a lawsuit seeking to overturn a record 135 billion-won (US$91 million) fine handed down by the state data protection regulator over a massive data leak last year that affected its entire 23 million user base, industry sources said Monday. SK Telecom filed... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Alerted to a breach in November, Advanced Family Surgery Center remains publicly silent
item.description:
Advanced Family Surgery Center (AFSC) in Oak Ridge, Tennessee is part of Covenant HeaLth. According to threat actors known as Genesis, on November 26, 2025, they contacted AFSC to inform them they had been compromised. Days later, a spokesperson informs DataBreaches, someone showed up to negotiate, but the negotiations reportedly never went anywhere. On January... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Cloudflare whacks WAF bypass bug that opened side door for attackers
item.description:
Jessica Lyons report: Cloudflare has fixed a flaw in its web application firewall (WAF) that allowed attackers to bypass security rules and directly access origin servers, which could lead to data theft or full server takeover. FearsOff security researchers reported the bug in October through Cloudflareâ€™sÂ bug bountyÂ program, and the CDN says it has patched the... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: DOGE Employees Shared Social Security Data, Court Filing Shows
item.description:
Eileen Sullivan reports: Employees with the Department of Government Efficiency who were detailed to the Social Security Administration last March shared sensitive data through a nonsecure third party server, in violation of agency security policies, the Justice Department disclosed in a court filing. The Social Security Administration does not know what data was shared on... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: Hong Kong issues Code of Practice under the Protection of Critical Infrastructures (Computer Systems) Ordinance
item.description:
Gabriela Kennedy, Joanna K.C. Wong, and Roslie Liu of Mayer|Brown write: On 1 January 2026, the Office of the Commissioner of Critical Infrastructure (Computer-system Security) issued a Code of Practice (the â€œCoPâ€) under the Protection of Critical Infrastructures (Computer Systems) Ordinance (Cap. 653) (the â€œOrdinanceâ€), which came into force on the same day (see our... Source
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach

item.title: EPIC Releases New Report on Protecting Health Privacy in the Digital Age
item.description:
Today the Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC) releasedÂ Beyond HIPAA: Reimagining How Privacy Laws Apply to Health Data to Maximize Equity in the Digital Age.Â The reportÂ examinesÂ and proposes solutions toÂ the health data privacy crisisâ€”a product ofÂ unregulated digital technologies,Â weak privacy laws,Â theÂ criminalizationÂ ofÂ many forms ofÂ health care, and growingÂ federal attacks on marginalized communities. Through commercialÂ surveillance,Â our health data is extractedÂ to profile us,Â reveal
ğŸ“° Source: DataBreaches.net | ğŸ·ï¸ Type: Data Breach
